header: The War Between Israel and Benjamin

verse: So all the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] from Dan to Beersheba [from the farthest north to the farthest south], including the land of Gilead [on the east side of the Jordan River], ·joined together [assembled] before the Lord in the city of Mizpah.
The ·leaders [cornerstones; Is. 19:13] of all the tribes of Israel took their places in the ·meeting [assembly] of the people of God. There were 400,000 soldiers ·with swords [who drew the sword].

(The ·people [sons; descendants] of Benjamin heard that the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] had gone up to Mizpah.) Then the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] said to the Levite, “Tell us how this evil thing happened.”
So the husband of the murdered woman answered, “My ·slave woman [concubine; 8:31] and I came to Gibeah in Benjamin to spend the night.

During the night the ·men [leaders; lords] of Gibeah came after me. They surrounded the house and wanted to kill me. They ·forced my slave woman to have sexual relations [abused/raped my concubine] and she died.

I took her and cut her into parts and sent ·one part [her] to ·each area [every region of the inheritance] of Israel because the people of Benjamin did this ·wicked [lewd; abominable] and ·terrible [outrageous; shameful] thing in Israel.
Now, all you ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel], speak up. What is your decision?”
Then all the people stood up at the same time, saying, “None of us will go ·home [to his tent]. Not one of us will go back to his house!
Now this is what we will do to Gibeah. We will ·throw lots [go against it by lot].

That way we will choose ten men from every hundred men from all the tribes of Israel, and we will choose a hundred men from every thousand, and a thousand men from every ten thousand. These will find ·supplies [provisions; food] for the army. Then the army will go to the city of Gibeah of Benjamin to ·repay [punish] them for the ·terrible [outrageous; shameful] thing they have done in Israel.”
So all the men of Israel were united and gathered against the city.
The tribes of Israel sent men throughout the tribe of Benjamin demanding, “What is this ·evil [wicked; terrible] thing ·some of your men have done [that has taken place among you]?
Hand over the ·wicked [worthless; troublemaking] men in Gibeah so that we can put them to death. We must ·remove [purge] this evil from Israel.”
The ·Benjaminites [sons of Benjamin] left their own cities and met at Gibeah to fight the Israelites.

In only one day the ·Benjaminites [sons of Benjamin] ·got [mobilized; mustered] 26,000 soldiers together who ·were trained with swords [drew the sword]. They also had 700 ·chosen [elite; well-trained] men from Gibeah.
Among all these trained soldiers, seven hundred were left-handed [3:15], each of whom could sling a stone at a hair and not miss [1 Sam. 17:49]!
The Israelites, except for the Benjaminites, gathered 400,000 ·soldiers with swords [men who drew the sword, all of them men of war].

The ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] went up to the ·city of Bethel [or house of God; the meaning of the name “Bethel”] and asked God, “·Which tribe [Who] shall be first to attack the Benjaminites?”
The next morning the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] got up and ·made a camp near [or encamped against] Gibeah.
The men of Israel went out to fight the Benjaminites and took their battle position at Gibeah.
Then the ·Benjaminites [sons/descendants of Benjamin] came out of Gibeah and killed 22,000 Israelites during the battle that day.
The ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] ·came to fight [drew near to] the ·Benjaminites [sons/descendants of Benjamin] the second day.
The Benjaminites came out of Gibeah to attack the Israelites. This time, the Benjaminites killed 18,000 ·Israelites [men of the sons/children of Israel], all of whom ·carried swords [drew the sword].

Then all the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel], the whole army, went up to Bethel [v. 18]. There they sat down and cried to the Lord and fasted all day until evening. They also brought burnt offerings and ·fellowship [or peace] offerings to the Lord.
The ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] asked the Lord a question. (In those days the Ark of the ·Agreement with God [Covenant; Treaty] was there.

A priest named Phinehas son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, served before ·the Ark of the Agreement [it].) They asked, “Shall ·we [I] go to fight ·our relatives [my brother], the Benjaminites, again, or shall we stop fighting?”
Then the Israelites set up ambushes all around Gibeah.
They went to fight against the Benjaminites at Gibeah on the third day, getting into position for battle as they had done before.

When the Benjaminites came out to fight them, the ·Israelites [people] backed up and drew them away from the city. The ·Benjaminites [sons/descendants of Benjamin] began to kill some of the ·Israelites [people] as they had done before. About thirty Israelites were killed—some in the fields and some on the roads leading to Bethel and to Gibeah.
The ·Benjaminites [sons/descendants of Benjamin] said, “We are winning as before!”

All the Israelites moved from their places and got into battle positions at a place named Baal Tamar. Then the Israelites ·ran out [charged; jumped up] from their hiding places ·west of Gibeah [or from Maareh-geba].

Ten thousand of the ·best trained [elite; chosen] soldiers from all of Israel attacked Gibeah. The battle was very hard. The Benjaminites did not know disaster was ·about to come to them [close at hand; touching against them].

The Lord ·used the Israelites to defeat the Benjaminites [struck Benjamin in front of Israel]. On that day the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] killed 25,100 Benjaminites, ·all armed with swords [who drew the sword].
Then the ·Benjaminites [sons/descendants of Benjamin] saw that they were defeated.
The men in ·hiding [ambush] rushed into Gibeah, spread out, and killed everyone in the city with ·their swords [the edge of the sword].
Now the Israelites had set up a signal with the men in hiding. The men in the ·surprise attack [ambush] were to send up a cloud of smoke from the city.
Then the army of Israel ·turned around in the battle [counterattacked; a similar strategy was used against Ai; Josh. 8].
But then a cloud of smoke began to rise from the city. The Benjaminites turned around and ·saw that [look; behold] the whole city was going up ·in smoke [into the sky/heavens].
Then the Israelites turned and began to fight. The Benjaminites were terrified because they knew that disaster was ·coming to them [close at hand; touching against them].

So the Benjaminites ran away from the Israelites toward the ·desert [wilderness], but ·they could not escape the battle [the battle pursued/overtook them]. And the Israelites who came out of the cities ·killed [struck; destroyed] them.
They surrounded the Benjaminites and chased them and ·caught [overtook; stomped on] them in the area east of ·Gibeah [or Geba].
So 18,000 ·brave [valiant; capable] Benjaminite fighters were killed.

The Benjaminites ·ran [fled; retreated] toward the ·desert [wilderness] to the rock of Rimmon, but the Israelites ·killed [cut down; gleaned] 5,000 Benjaminites along the roads. They chased them as far as Gidom and ·killed [struck down] 2,000 more Benjaminites there.
On that day 25,000 Benjaminites were killed, ·all of whom had fought bravely with swords [valiant/capable men who drew the sword].
But 600 Benjaminites ran to the rock of Rimmon in the ·desert [wilderness], where they stayed for four months.

Then the Israelites went back to the ·land [sons] of Benjamin and killed the people in every city and also the animals and everything they could find. And they burned every city they ·found [came to].
